title: The Senate Crime Investigations: Part One

sources.title: Sisters in Crime (1951) Crime, Film-Noir | with Hugh Beaumont | directed by William Berke
sources.description:
Dennis O'Brien is a private investigator, and he is hired to place bets on a rigged fight, only to get framed for murder when the plan goes awry. Investigating on his own, he uncovers betrayals and double-crosses but is repeatedly knocked out and blamed by police. In a second case, Dennis is hired to pose as a missing husband, leading to a string of deaths and a final confrontation that reveals a twisted family plot and a series of murders driven by greed.

Original title: Roaring City (1951) AKA: Sisters in Crime

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/c8P9_rSAKYY


Director: William Berke
Writers: Julian Harmon, Victor West, Lou Morheim
Stars: Hugh Beaumont, Edward Brophy, Richard Travis, Joan Valerie
Genres: Action, Adventure, Crime, Film Noir


@CultCinemaClassics 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2gsu7VGzgdZ0h0ouY9tWI-vfLlRO1Nt2

metadata.Plot: The first part of a recording from the US senate committee's hearings into organized crime that would influence many future crime films.
metadata.Actors: Frank Erickson, Rudolph Halley, Estes Kefauver
